medical_history.chief_complaint: Right-sided facial nodules present for 1 year.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first lesion developed on the right cheek, followed by additional lesions along the right mandible and below the right ear. Accelerated growth of the lesion on the right cheek was noted during a 6-month period prior to presentation. There was no history of fevers, chills, or night sweats.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient exhibited the full spectrum of WHIM syndrome, with a history of warts, hypogammaglobulinemia, recurrent bacterial infections, and severe leukopenia. He was hospitalized in 1992 and 1993 for a shoulder abscess and an abdominal abscess, respectively. He had otherwise been healthy before the development of the facial nodules.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother, sister, brother, and one niece also have WHIM syndrome.
